data.question: What is the highest ambient conductivity achieved for the series of solid electrolytes based on LiI and 3-hydroxypropionitrile (HPN)?
What effect does the addition of micrometer-sized and nanosized SiO2 particles have on the solid electrolyte for DSSC?
data.answer: It enhances the conductivity and improves the interfacial contact between electrode/electrolyte greatly.

data.question: How does the light-to-electricity conversion efficiency of a DSSC using LiI(HPN)4/15 wt % nano-SiO2 compare under AM 1.5 simulated solar light illumination?
data.answer: A conversion efficiency of 5.4% was achieved.

data.question: What is the relationship between the addition of SiO2 to the electrolyte and the performance of DSSC?
data.answer: The performance of DSSC improves when silica is added into the electrolyte, with the conversion efficiency increasing from 1.4% for LiI(HPN)4 to 3.6% for LiI(HPN)4/20 wt % μm-SiO2.

data.question: What is the role of 4-tert-butylpyridine (TBP) in the performance of DSSC fabricated with composite electrolyte LiI(HPN)4/20 wt % μm-SiO2?
data.answer: The addition of TBP increases the Voc and fill factor of the DSSC, leading to an overall conversion efficiency increase from 3.6% to 4.1%.

data.question: What is the effect of iodine concentration on the conductivity of the electrolyte LiI(HPN)4 or LiI(HPN)4/20 wt % SiO2?
data.answer: The conductivity decreases with increasing iodine concentration at a concentration range of 0 ≤ I2:I- ≤ 1:10 (molar ratio).

data.question: Is the light-to-electricity conversion efficiency of the DSSC based on the new solid-state composite electrolyte promising for practical applications?
Does the addition of SiO2 particles to the solid electrolyte lead to a decrease in the size of crystallites formed at room temperature?
Is the activation energy for the hopping of I- ions lower than that of Li+ ions in the compound LiI(HPN)2?
Does the addition of iodine to the electrolyte always result in an increase in the Jsc of DSSC?
Is the performance of DSSC using LiI(HPN)4 as electrolyte limited by the mass transport of I-/I3- in nanocrystalline TiO2 films?
Does the addition of nanometer-sized silica to the solid electrolyte decrease the light-to-electricity conversion efficiency of DSSC?
Is the long-term stability of the DSSC fabricated with nanocomposite electrolyte LiI(HPN)4/15 wt % SiO2 promising based on its performance after one month of storage?
